titleStmt.title: Green Forrest et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4639

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners respectfully state that in an affray Voluntine Mudd Shot Charles Smith in Marion County Ky & was convicted at the May Term 1862 of the Marion Cit Ct of manslaughter & sentenced to two years imprisonment in the Penetentiary. That they are familiar with the facts of the case and they concur in the opinion that he was improperly convicted & that he has behaved well since his conviction. That he is young & was always a good boy ^well behaved before the unfortunate ^ The appeal for his pardon &c &c

Green Forrest
J. R. Thomas
B. Spalding
J H Chandler
Jn. B. Carlile
Wm W Warring

Marion Cir Ct
vs
Volentine Mudd
Pardoned by order of the Governor 1st Feby 1864
J R Page
Asst Sec
